headline.main: 3 1/4 BILLIONS SPENT BY CANADA ON WAR; Royal Bank of Canada Lists the Commitments by Dominion

lead_paragraph: War contracts placed in Canada since the beginning of the war now exceed $2,500,000,000, and about one-half of the industrial workers in the Dominion are engaged in production associated with wartime needs, the Royal Bank of Canada states in the current issue of its business publication released today.
abstract: Royal Bank of Canada makes similar rept
